channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024010418
item.description:
Report X-2024010418

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-23T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010418 A HAZMAT AUDITOR CAME BY AND SAID ONE OF THE HAZMATS ON THEIR TRAM HAD A STRONG CHEMICAL SELL AND POINTED TO A HAZMAT WITH BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMONS HAZARD LABELS. OPENING AND INSPECTING THE PACKAGE RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS. ONE OF THE CAPS WAS MISSING THE PAPER SEAL UNDERNEATH WHICH ALLOWED SOME OF THE LIQUID INSIDE TO DRIBBLE OUT AND WET A PORTION OF THE CARDBOARD INSIDE. 2. X-2024010419 AUDITOR NOTED A STRONG SMELL COMING FROM PACKAGE AND CONTACTED AUTITOR. AUDITOR REMOVED PACKAGE TO THE DMP PROCESSING FACILITY. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT ONE INNER CONTAINER WAS MISSING THE SEAL INSERT IN THE VENTED CAP, CAUSINT THE CONTAINER TO LEAK A SMALL AMOUNT AND STAIN THE OUTER BOX. ALL CONTAINERS DISPOSED VIA DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024010468
item.description:
Report X-2024010468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: after scanning this package to a van this morning, someone removed it and placed it in a lined tote, then had it brought to the damage area and moved to the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap and inadequate outer pack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats
